cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi W of the Dry Tortugas and 450 mi SSE of Pensacola, FL
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, turning north and aiming for the northern Gulf Coast (Alabama–Florida Panhandle)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Alabama/Florida border – central Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (warnings expected later for portions of FL Panhandle/AL coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama through the central Florida Panhandle; inland across AL, GA, and the western Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Thu–Fri (<34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware Bay or the Port of Wilmington
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain (2–4 in.) possible Thursday–Friday as remnants pass inland to the west
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized river or urban flooding from persistent rain bands
